description: False Indigo (Baptisia bracteata) is an amazing plant species that is a joy to behold. This perennial shrub has striking deep blue or purple flowers and fern-like grey-green foliage that grows in abundance each year. Typically flowering in the spring months, False Indigo is highly drought tolerant, making it perfect for dry gardens. Not only is it a vivid presence in any landscape, False Indigo also produces attractive seedpods, some of which the plant retains in winter, beautifully decorating the garden when most other plants are hidden away. For those looking to make a statement in their garden with a resilient and aesthetically pleasing plant species, False Indigo should be their number one choice.
